definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: Thvia's why Bella can'tgo on a hunting trip with him.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼他不能帶上貝拉一起去狩獵遠足的因由。

sentences.english: Say Congress is considering a proposed federal cause of action for libel on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 說國會正在考慮擬議的聯邦訴訟因由誹謗在互聯網上。

sentences.english: Either Subscriber or CUHK may terminate this Agreement with or without cause at any time and effective immediately.
sentences.chinese: 訂戶或中大任何一方可不論因由隨時終止本協議。

sentences.english: The traditional views about getting married for love have all now changed for other reasons.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的爲愛而結婚的觀點已經全部的變化爲其它因由。

sentences.english: Be wary of minimalism as an aesthetic decision without cause.
sentences.chinese: 警惕沒有任何因由的極簡美學主義決定。

sentences.english: You can illustrate the two ways of tackling the issue through method A and method B.
sentences.chinese: 你可以通過比較方法A和方法B來查找因由。

definition: variant of 緣由|缘由[yuan2 you2]
the whys and the wherefores/the detailed story/root cause
to get to the heart of the matter
a secret/sth best not told to anyone/confidential information
sth one wishes to keep secret/ulterior motive/a subject best avoided
cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
